pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā dabbo mallaputto saṅghassa senāsanañca paññapeti bhattāni ca uddisati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.2.eng: At that time Venerable Dabba the Mallian was assigning the dwellings and designating the meals,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū navakā ceva honti appapuññā ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.3.eng: and the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka were newly ordained.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.4.pli: Yāni saṅghassa lāmakāni senāsanāni tāni tesaṃ pāpuṇanti lāmakāni ca bhattāni.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.4.eng: They had little merit, getting inferior dwellings and meals.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.5.pli: Te āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ bhikkhū ujjhāpenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.5.eng: They then complained about Dabba to other monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.6.pli: “chandāya dabbo mallaputto senāsanaṃ paññapeti, chandāya ca bhattāni uddisatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.6.eng: “Dabba the Mallian assigns dwellings and designates meals based on favoritism.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.7.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ bhikkhū ujjhāpessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.8.eng: “How can the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka complain about Venerable Dabba to other monks?”…

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ bhikkhū ujjhāpethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ bhikkhū ujjhāpessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.12.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.14.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.15.1.eng: ‘If a monk complains, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.16.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:1.16.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:2.1.eng: Knowing that the Buddha had prohibited complaining, the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka thought of other ways of getting the monks to hear about their grievances.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:2.2.pli: “‘bhagavatā ujjhāpanakaṃ paṭikkhittan’ti ‘ettāvatā bhikkhū sossantī’”ti bhikkhūnaṃ sāmantā āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ khiyyanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:2.2.eng: They then criticized Dabba the Mallian in the vicinity of other monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:2.3.pli: “chandāya dabbo mallaputto senāsanaṃ paññapeti, chandāya ca bhattāni uddisatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:2.3.eng: “Dabba assigns dwellings and designates meals based on favoritism.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:2.4.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:2.4.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:2.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ khiyyissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:2.5.eng: “How can the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka criticize Venerable Dabba?”…

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:2.6.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ khiyyathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:2.6.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:2.9.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ khiyyissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:2.9.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:2.11.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:2.11.eng: “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:2.12.1.eng: ‘If a monk complains or criticizes, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:2.12.1.comm: There is no equivalent of the “or” in the Pali, but it is implied by the origin story, which gives a separate offense for complaining.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.1.2.pli: upasampannaṃ saṅghena sammataṃ senāsanapaññāpakaṃ vā bhattuddesakaṃ vā yāgubhājakaṃ vā phalabhājakaṃ vā khajjabhājakaṃ vā appamattakavissajjakaṃ vā avaṇṇaṃ kattukāmo, ayasaṃ kattukāmo, maṅkukattukāmo, upasampannaṃ ujjhāpeti vā khiyyati vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.1.2.eng: when someone who is fully ordained is the assigner of dwellings or the designator of meals or the distributor of congee or the distributor of fruit or the distributor of fresh foods or the distributor of small requisites, and he has been appointed by the Sangha as such, then if a monk complains about him or criticizes him to one who is fully ordained—desiring to disparage him, desiring to give him a bad reputation, desiring to humiliate him—he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.1.2.comm: According to Sp 2.615 (commenting on the sekhiya rules) khajja/khajjaka refers to all fresh foods: Ettha mūlakhādanīyādi sabbaṁ gahetabbaṁ, “Here the fresh foods which are roots, etc., may all be taken.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.1.3.1.pli: Dhammakamme dhammakammasaññī ujjhāpanake khiyyanake āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.1.3.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, and he complains or criticizes, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.1.3.1.comm: The legal procedure referred to here is the procedure of making a monk an officer of the Sangha. Sp 2.106: Dhammakamme dhammakammasaññītiādīsu yaṁ tassa upasampannassa sammutikammaṁ kataṁ, “In regard to dhammakamme dhammakammasaññī etc.: the legal procedure done to approve a fully ordained person.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.1.4.pli: Dhammakamme vematiko ujjhāpanake khiyyanake āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.1.4.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, and he complains or criticizes, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.1.5.pli: Dhammakamme adhammakammasaññī ujjhāpanake khiyyanake āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.1.5.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he complains or criticizes, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.2.1.pli: Anupasampannaṃ ujjhāpeti vā khiyyati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.2.1.eng: If he complains or criticizes him to one who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.2.2.pli: Upasampannaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ senāsanapaññāpakaṃ vā bhattuddesakaṃ vā yāgubhājakaṃ vā phalabhājakaṃ vā khajjabhājakaṃ vā appamattakavissajjakaṃ vā avaṇṇaṃ kattukāmo, ayasaṃ kattukāmo, maṅkukattukāmo, upasampannaṃ vā anupasampannaṃ vā ujjhāpeti vā khiyyati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.2.2.eng: When someone who is fully ordained is the assigner of dwellings or the designator of meals or the distributor of congee or the distributor of fruit or the distributor of fresh foods or the distributor of small requisites, but he has not been appointed by the Sangha as such, then if a monk complains about him or criticizes him to one who is fully ordained or to one who is not fully ordained—desiring to disparage him, desiring to give him a bad reputation, desiring to humiliate him—he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.2.3.pli: Anupasampannaṃ saṅghena sammataṃ vā asammataṃ vā senāsanapaññāpakaṃ vā bhattuddesakaṃ vā yāgubhājakaṃ vā phalabhājakaṃ vā khajjabhājakaṃ vā appamattakavissajjakaṃ vā avaṇṇaṃ kattukāmo, ayasaṃ kattukāmo, maṅkukattukāmo, upasampannaṃ vā anupasampannaṃ vā ujjhāpeti vā khiyyati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.2.3.eng: When someone who is not fully ordained is the assigner of dwellings or the designator of meals or the distributor of congee or the distributor of fruit or the distributor of fresh foods or the distributor of small requisites, whether he has been appointed by the Sangha as such or not, then if a monk complains about him or criticizes him to one who is fully ordained or to one who is not fully ordained—desiring to disparage him, desiring to give him a bad reputation, desiring to humiliate him—he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.2.4.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as legitimate, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.2.5.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.2.6.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.3.2.pli: pakatiyā chandā dosā mohā bhayā karontaṃ ujjhāpeti vā khiyyati vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.3.2.eng: if he complains about or criticizes one who regularly acts out of favoritism, ill will, confusion, or fear;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.3.4.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc13:3.3.5.eng: The training rule on complaining, the third, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery during winter,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū hemantike kāle ajjhokāse senāsanaṃ paññapetvā kāyaṃ otāpentā kāle ārocite taṃ pakkamantā neva uddhariṃsu na uddharāpesuṃ, anāpucchā pakkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.2.eng: the monks put furniture out in the open in order to warm themselves in the sun. But when the time for departure was announced, they departed without putting it away, having it put away, or informing anyone.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.2.comm: For the meaning of senāsana, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.4.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.4.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.5.pli: “kathaṃ hi nāma bhikkhū ajjhokāse senāsanaṃ paññapetvā taṃ pakkamantā neva uddharissanti na uddharāpessanti, anāpucchā pakkamissanti, senāsanaṃ ovaṭṭhan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.5.eng: “How could those monks put furniture out in the open and then depart without putting it away, having it put away, or informing anyone? The furniture was rained on.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.6.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū te anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.6.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.7.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.8.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.8.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.9.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu saṅghikaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā bhisiṃ vā kocchaṃ vā ajjhokāse santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto neva uddhareyya na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.9.1.eng: ‘If a monk takes a bed, a bench, a mattress, or a stool belonging to the Sangha and puts it out in the open or has it put out in the open, and he then departs without putting it away, having it put away, or informing anyone, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.10.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.10.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū ajjhokāse vasitvā kālasseva senāsanaṃ abhiharanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards, monks who had stayed out in the open brought the furniture back even though it was not the rainy season.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.2.2.pli: Addasā kho bhagavā te bhikkhū kālasseva senāsanaṃ abhiharante.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.2.3.pli: Disvāna etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.2.3.eng: After giving a teaching, he addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.2.4.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, aṭṭha māse avassikasaṅkete maṇḍape vā rukkhamūle vā yattha kākā vā kulalā vā na ūhadanti tattha senāsanaṃ nikkhipitun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.2.4.eng: “Monks, during the eight months outside of the rainy season, I allow you to store furniture under a roof cover or at the foot of a tree or wherever crows or ravens don’t leave droppings.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.4.eng: …The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.6.eng: given to the Sangha, given up to the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.8.eng: there are four kinds of beds:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.9.eng: one with legs and frame, called masāraka; one with legs and frame, called bundikābaddha; one with crooked legs; one with detachable legs.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.9.comm: For a discussion of these and those below, see Appendix of Furniture.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.11.pli: cattāri pīṭhāni— masārakaṃ, bundikābaddhaṃ, kuḷīrapādakaṃ, āhaccapādakaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.11.eng: there are four kinds of benches: one with legs and frame, called masāraka; one with legs and frame, called bundikābaddha; one with crooked legs; one with detachable legs.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.13.pli: pañca bhisiyo— uṇṇabhisi, coḷabhisi, vākabhisi, tiṇabhisi, paṇṇabhisi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.13.eng: there are five kinds of mattresses: a mattress stuffed with wool, a mattress stuffed with cloth, a mattress stuffed with bark, a mattress stuffed with grass, a mattress stuffed with leaves.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.15.pli: vākamayaṃ vā usīramayaṃ vā muñjamayaṃ vā pabbajamayaṃ vā anto saṃveṭhetvā baddhaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.15.eng: one made of bark, one made of vetiver grass, one made of reed. It is upholstered and then bound together.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.15.comm: I have rendered muñja-reed and pabbaja-reed with the single word “reed”. I am not aware that these different species of reed can be properly distinguished in English.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.20.eng: If he gets one who is not fully ordained to put it, it is the responsibility of the monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.21.eng: If he gets one who is fully ordained to put it, it is the responsibility of the one who puts it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.23.eng: he does not put it away himself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.25.eng: he does not get another to put it away.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.27.pli: bhikkhuṃ vā sāmaṇeraṃ vā ārāmikaṃ vā anāpucchā majjhimassa purisassa leḍḍupātaṃ atikkamantassa āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.27.eng: if he does not inform a monk, a novice monk, or a monastery worker, then when he goes beyond the distance of a stone’s throw of an average man, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.2.1.pli: Saṅghike saṅghikasaññī ajjhokāse santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto neva uddhareyya na uddharāpeyya anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.2.1.eng: If it belongs to the Sangha, and he perceives it as such, and he puts it out in the open or has it put out in the open, and he then departs without putting it away or having it put away or informing anyone, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.2.1.comm: “Out in the open” renders ajjhokāsa. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.2.2.eng: If it belongs to the Sangha, but he is unsure of it …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.2.3.pli: saṅghike puggalikasaññī ajjhokāse santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto neva uddhareyya na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.2.3.eng: If it belongs to the Sangha, but he perceives it as belonging to an individual, and he puts it out in the open or has it put out in the open, and he then departs without putting it away or having it put away or informing anyone, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.2.4.pli: Cimilikaṃ vā uttarattharaṇaṃ vā bhūmattharaṇaṃ vā taṭṭikaṃ vā cammakhaṇḍaṃ vā pādapuñchaniṃ vā phalakapīṭhaṃ vā ajjhokāse santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto neva uddhareyya na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.2.4.eng: If it is a mat underlay, a bedspread, a floor cover, a straw mat, a hide, a foot-wiping cloth, or a plank bench, and he puts it out in the open or has it put out in the open, and he then departs without putting it away or having it put away or informing anyone, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.2.4.comm: Sp-yoj 2.112: Cammakhaṇḍoti ettha cammaṁyeva ante khaṇḍattā chinnattā cammakhaṇḍoti vuccati, “Here cammakhaṇḍa is just a hide. Because it is cut up within and made of pieces, it called a cammakhaṇḍa.” For the meaning of cimilikā, “a mat underlay”, see Appendix of Furniture.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.2.5.eng: If it belongs to an individual, but he perceives it as belonging to the Sangha, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.2.6.eng: If it belongs to an individual, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.2.7.pli: Puggalike puggalikasaññī aññassa puggalike, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.2.7.eng: If it belongs to an individual, and he perceives it as such, but that individual is not himself, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.2.8.eng: If it belongs to himself, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.3.2.eng: if he departs after putting it away;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.3.3.eng: if he departs after having it put away;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.3.4.eng: if he departs after informing someone;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.3.5.eng: if he departs while he is sunning it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.3.6.comm: Sp 2.113: Kenaci palibuddhaṁ hotīti senāsanaṁ kenaci upaddutaṁ hotīti attho, “Kenaci palibuddhaṁ hoti: the meaning is that the furniture is controlled by something.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.3.7.comm: “Emergency” renders āpadāsu. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.3.9.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.3.10.eng: The training rule on furniture, the fourth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:0.5.eng: 15. The second training rule on furniture

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sattarasavaggiyā bhikkhū sahāyakā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of seventeen were friends.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.3.pli: Te vasantāpi ekatova vasanti, pakkamantāpi ekatova pakkamanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.3.eng: The lived together, and when going somewhere they would leave together.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.4.pli: Te aññatarasmiṃ saṅghike vihāre seyyaṃ santharitvā taṃ pakkamantā neva uddhariṃsu na uddharāpesuṃ, anāpucchā pakkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.4.eng: On one occasion they put out bedding in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, but then departed without putting it away, having it put away, or informing anyone.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.5.eng: The furniture was eaten by termites.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.5.comm: For the meaning of senāsana, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.6.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.6.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma sattarasavaggiyā bhikkhū saṅghike vihāre seyyaṃ santharitvā taṃ pakkamantā neva uddharissanti na uddharāpessanti, anāpucchā pakkamissanti, senāsanaṃ upacikāhi khāyitan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.7.eng: “How could those monks from the group of seventeen put out bedding in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, and then depart without putting it away, getting it put away, or informing anyone? The furniture was eaten by termites.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.8.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū sattarasavaggiye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.8.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, sattarasavaggiyā bhikkhū saṅghike vihāre seyyaṃ santharitvā taṃ pakkamantā neva uddhariṃsu na uddharāpesuṃ, anāpucchā pakkamiṃsu, senāsanaṃ upacikāhi khāyitan”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that those monks did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā saṅghike vihāre seyyaṃ santharitvā taṃ pakkamantā neva uddharissanti na uddharāpessanti, anāpucchā pakkamissanti, senāsanaṃ upacikāhi khāyitaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.12.eng: “How could those foolish men do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.14.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.15.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre seyyaṃ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto neva uddhareyya na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:1.15.1.eng: ‘If a monk puts out bedding in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, or has it put out, and he then departs without putting it away, having it put away, or informing anyone, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.1.4.eng: …The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.1.5.eng: A dwelling belonging to the Sangha:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.1.5.comm: I render vihāra as “dwelling”, the idea that it is a monastic dwelling being implied. In later usage, especially in the commentaries, vihāra comes to refer to entire monasteries, rather than individual dwellings. The commentaries seem to agree that in its early usage the word refers to a dwelling. Sp 1.493: Vihāro nivesanasadiso, “A vihāra is like a house.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.1.6.eng: given to the Sangha, given up to the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.1.8.pli: bhisi, cimilikā uttarattharaṇaṃ, bhūmattharaṇaṃ, taṭṭikā, cammakhaṇḍo, nisīdanaṃ, paccattharaṇaṃ, tiṇasanthāro, paṇṇasanthāro.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.1.8.eng: a mattress, a mat underlay, a bedspread, a floor cover, a straw mat, a hide, a sitting mat, a sheet, a spread of grass, a spread of leaves.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.1.8.comm: Sp-yoj 2.112: Cammakhaṇḍoti ettha cammaṁyeva ante khaṇḍattā chinnattā cammakhaṇḍoti vuccati, “Here cammakhaṇḍa is just a hide. Because it is cut up within and made of pieces, it is called a cammakhaṇḍa.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.1.14.eng: he does not put it away himself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.1.16.eng: he does not get another to put it away.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.1.18.pli: bhikkhuṃ vā sāmaṇeraṃ vā ārāmikaṃ vā anāpucchā parikkhittassa ārāmassa parikkhepaṃ atikkamantassa āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.1.18.eng: if he does not inform a monk, a novice monk, or a monastery worker, and he crosses the boundary of an enclosed monastery, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.1.19.pli: Aparikkhittassa ārāmassa upacāraṃ atikkamantassa āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.1.19.eng: If he goes beyond the vicinity of an unenclosed monastery, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.2.1.pli: Saṅghike saṅghikasaññī seyyaṃ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto neva uddhareyya na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.2.1.eng: If it belongs to the Sangha, and he perceives it as such, and he puts out bedding there or has it put out, and he then departs without putting it away or having it put away or informing anyone, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.2.2.pli: Saṅghike vematiko seyyaṃ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto neva uddhareyya na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.2.2.eng: If it belongs to the Sangha, but he is unsure of it, and he puts out bedding there or has it put out, and he then departs without putting it away or having it put away or informing anyone, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.2.3.pli: Saṅghike puggalikasaññī seyyaṃ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto neva uddhareyya na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.2.3.eng: If it belongs to the Sangha, but he perceives it as belonging to an individual, and he puts out bedding there or has it put out, and he then departs without putting it away or having it put away or informing anyone, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.2.4.pli: Vihārassa upacāre vā upaṭṭhānasālāyaṃ vā maṇḍape vā rukkhamūle vā seyyaṃ santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto neva uddhareyya na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.2.4.eng: If he puts out bedding, or has it put out, in the vicinity of a dwelling, in the assembly hall, under a roof-cover, or at the foot of a tree, and he then departs without putting it away or having it put away or informing anyone, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.2.5.pli: Mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā vihāre vā vihārassūpacāre vā upaṭṭhānasālāyaṃ vā maṇḍape vā rukkhamūle vā santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto neva uddhareyya na uddharāpeyya, anāpucchaṃ vā gaccheyya, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.2.5.eng: If he puts out a bed or a bench, or has it put out, in a dwelling, in the vicinity of a dwelling, in the assembly hall, under a roof cover, or at the foot of a tree, and he then departs without putting it away or having it put away or informing anyone, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.2.6.eng: If it belongs to an individual, but he perceives it as belonging to the Sangha, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.2.7.eng: If it belongs to an individual, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.2.8.pli: Puggalike puggalikasaññī aññassa puggalike āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.2.8.eng: If it belongs to an individual, and he perceives it as such, but that individual is not himself, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.2.9.eng: If it belongs to himself, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.3.2.eng: if he departs after putting it away;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.3.3.eng: if he departs after having it put away;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.3.4.eng: if he departs after informing someone;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.3.5.comm: Sp 2.118: Kenaci palibuddhaṁ hotīti vuḍḍhatarabhikkhūissariyayakkhasīhavāḷamigakaṇhasappādīsu yena kenaci senāsanaṁ palibuddhaṁ hoti, “Kenaci palibuddhaṁ hoti: by whatever the furniture is obstructed, such as the authority of more senior monks, a spirit, a lion, a wild beast, or a black snake.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.3.6.eng: if he abandons his intention to return, and at that spot informs anyone;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.3.10.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc15:2.3.11.eng: The second training rule on furniture, the fifth, is finished.
